content.question: The use of a conceit in lines 12-14 (“Let . . . one”) allows the speaker to focus on a complex comparison between

choices.label: being acquisitive and being satisfied with what one already has
reunited lovers and disoriented world explorers
remote, exotic locations and local scenes of pastoral life
collectively accessible worlds and a private world shared by the lovers

content.answer: collectively accessible worlds and a private world shared by the lovers

skill.text: Skill 6.B: Identify and explain the function of a metaphor.
